name: VoiceinCanadaFlashBriefing
0:
”Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?”
”Alexa, what's in the news?”
skdetail:
Flash Briefing Skill
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
In this daily, short, 2-minute flash briefing (ie. briefcast), discover top Amazon Alexa and Echo tips, tricks, skills, reviews, news, and deals. Dr Teri Fisher, from the Voice in Canada Podcast and Blog, reveals how to get the most out of Alexa’s voice-first service so you can have the time and freedom to make your life more organized, relaxed, stress-free, entertaining, and fun! 

We cover everything from Amazon Echo devices (e.g. Echo Dot, Echo Show, Echo Plus, and many others), smart home automation, and flash briefings, to voice recognition, natural language processing, and artificial intelligence (AI). Find out everything that works (and doesn’t work) to help get Alexa working for you.

https://VoiceInCanada.ca

ABOUT THE HOST:
Dr Teri Fisher, dubbed “The Voice Doctor,” is a unique blend of award-winning TEDx and keynote performer, physician, podcaster, author, educator, and leading authority on all things voice technology. He believes that voice technology is the next operating system, and the future of computers and artificial intelligence. Teri, known for his laid-back, friendly, personable, and upbeat style, breaks down the complexities of voice technology to it’s simple parts and is your guide to navigating the world of voice. An Alexa Champion, Bixby Premier Developer, winner of the Project Voice 2020 “Flash Briefing of the Year”, and finalist for “Voice AI/Commentator of the Year” 2020 and “Commentator of the Year” 2019, Teri is a leader in voice technology around the globe.

Teri is the founder of the Voice in Canada podcast, blog, and daily flash briefing, the #1 rated Amazon Alexa flash briefing and news skill in Canada. He developed the first gamified flash briefing experience and voice marketing funnel, built on top of Voice in Canada, to rave reviews. Teri also serves the voice community through his course, Flash Briefing Formula, the most comprehensive flash briefing course available today. This course is a step-by-step instruction manual for the entire process of creating, developing, launching, and marketing a top-rated flash briefing. This can be accessed at http://FlashBriefingFormula.com

Teri is also the founder of Briefcast.FM, the premier flash briefing network that curates the best flash briefings available on Amazon Alexa. You can browse the catalog at https://Briefcast.FM

Teri is also the creator and host of The Voice Den, a revolutionary online voice technology reality show that combines his passions for voice technology and education in a fun, relaxed and entertaining style. Featuring live spontaneous conversations between the most influential people in the voice first industry - the Voicefluencers - and YOU, each monthly session is full of laughs and surprises! Feel free to enter the Den at http://TheVoiceDen.com

Teri is a Sport & Exercise Physician and Clinical Assistant Professor at the University of British Columbia (UBC). He is the founder of Voice First Health, the leading podcast at the intersection of voice-first technology and healthcare. Teri is the co-author of the landmark book, “Voice Technology in Healthcare: Leveraging Voice to Enhance Patient and Provider Experiences.”

For more information, please visit https://DrTeriFisher.com or connect with Teri on twitter @DrTeriFisher

Voice in Canada is an independent publications and has not been authorized, sponsored, or otherwise approved by Amazon, Apple, Google, Microsoft, Samsung, or any other company.
priv:
